intro: Fedia laxa, commonly known as the slender fedia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Fedia laxa is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
